medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began suddenly while the patient was asleep, leading to a presentation at an outside hospital. The patient vomited contrast from a CT scan on HD1 but reported complete resolution of symptoms. After initial discharge and subsequent vomiting attributed to broth taste, severe vomiting developed on the way home, prompting re-admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, Hyperlipidemia, Hypothyroidism, Peripheral neuropathy, Kidney stones, Papillary urethral cancer, Marginal ulcer post Roux-en-Y gastric bypass, post thyroidectomy, post ACL repair
medical_history.family_history: Father: deceased, CAD; Mother: deceased, COPD; Brother: MI, cerebral palsy
